## Bio

Hi ! I'm Léonie Courcoul. I am a PhD student in Biostatistics at the [University of Bordeaux (France)](https://www.u-bordeaux.fr/), in the [Biostatistic team](https://www.bordeaux-population-health.center/les-equipes/biostatistique/) from [Bordeaux population heath center (INSERM UMR1219)](https://www.bordeaux-population-health.center/en/) since November 2021. I do my research under the supervision of Hélène Jacqmin-Gadda and [Antoine Barbieri] (https://antoinebarbieri.netlify.app/). My thesis work are focused on the development of statistical models to study the impact of the variability of blood pressure on the risk of various clinical events such as stroke and dementia.
